definition[0]: the money or advantage you gain from a business, project, or something you have done
example[0]: The immediate payback for them is publicity.
definition[1]: when you do something to make someone suffer because of something they have done to harm you
definition[2]: the money or rewards gained from a new business, project etc
example[2]: One hurdle that often trips new entrepreneurs is the amount of time invested in a start-up before realizing any payback.
example[3]: It is a solid project that will generate hard currency with a fairly shortpayback period (=the period of time needed to get back the cost of an investment).
definition[3]: an illegal payment by a financial institution to an investor to replace money they have lost
example[4]: Executives were worried that the credit transfer would look like payback.
example[5]: Thepayback deals might never have come to light had local tax officials not leaked the schemes to the press.
